node.text: The Apothecary's inside, but he isn't seeing anyone right now. If you're sick, I heard there's a druid man around who's been helping people. I'd advise staying away from the traditional 'healer' though - trust me, her remedies will only put you in a worse state.

option.optiontext: And who might you be?
As you say.

node.text: Name's Fiona, been apprenticing for the apothecary. 'Course I hate to say it, but I've not been too much of help here. Master's been studying the plague that passed through the city, the Blistering Plight they call it.

option.optiontext: You said you've not been of much help, why?
I'm new to the city, what can you tell me about this Blistering Plight?
Your master, who is he?

node.text: Requires the kind of work that goes beyond my abilities. For starters, my master says I'd need a protective suit - a plague doctor's outfit. The ancestors know, I'm good with a bonesaw but I always hated the thread and needle...

Though he won't admit it, I think my master could really use an extra pair of hands right now. If you're more capable, I suggest you talk to tailor Francis down near Beggar's Gate - he can tell you how to craft the outfit.

It started some months ago, I guess. First folk started shivering, sweating, a fever broke... Then they start coughing, like real bad, and this nasty yellowish pus starts coming out as they do... their skin goes red like a lobster's, and then starts getting covered in blisters...

Luckily it's receded now, but it's been a real nightmare for those who caught it - a lot of folk died. And a lot who survived carry scars from those blisters. My master's still hoping to learn something, maybe so it could be prevented from happening again, you know?

option.optiontext: And your master, who is he?
You said you've not been of much help, why?

node.text: The great apothecary Sven Drogge from the Bronswind Academy of Learning and Excellence. He's, umm... kind of eccentric, has a repution for not being liked by his peers, I guess. But don't hold that against him, he's really good at what he does.

option.optiontext: The Bronswind Academy?
I'm new to the city, what can you tell me about this Blistering Plight?
You said you've not been of much help, why?

node.text: Yeah, don't you know? It's in the Kingdom of Melloria, it is like the most prestigious place of learning ever; for real skills and knowledge mind you, not like one of those schools where you learn magic tricks.

But my master doesn't spend much time there, he prefers to be out in the field, like here. He always said there's only so much one can learn stuck inside stone walls while breathing moldy air. Yeah, I guess that's one reason why his collegues dislike him...

option.optiontext: I'm new to the city, what can you tell me about this Blistering Plight?
You said you've not been of much help, why?

node.text: You're really doing it, aren't you? You're helping my master with his plague puzzles? I'm glad you're able to, he seemed very concerned to me.

option.optiontext: What can you tell me about this Blistering Plight?
Your master, who is he exactly?

node.text: I hear you did it! You helped my master thwart a potential second wave of the plague? That makes you a real plague doctor in my books!

option.optiontext: What can you tell me about this Blistering Plight?
Your master, who is he exactly?

node.text: Though he won't admit it, I think my master could really use an extra pair of hands right now. If you're more capable than I, you could talk to tailor Francis down near Beggar's Gate - he can tell you how to craft a plague doctor's outfit.

option.optiontext: What can you tell me about this Blistering Plight?
Your master, who is he exactly?

node.text: It started some months ago, I guess. First folk started shivering, sweating, a fever broke... Then they start coughing, like real bad, and this nasty yellowish pus starts coming out as they do... their skin goes red like a lobster's, and then starts getting covered in blisters...

Luckily it's receded now, but it's been a real nightmare for those who caught it - a lot of folk died. And a lot who survived carry scars from those blisters. My master's still hoping to learn something, maybe so it could be prevented from happening again, you know?

option.optiontext: And your master, who is he?
I see.

node.text: The great apothecary Sven Drogge from the Bronswind Academy of Learning and Excellence. He's, umm... kind of eccentric, has a repution for not being liked by his peers, I guess. But don't hold that against him, he's really good at what he does.

option.optiontext: The Bronswind Academy?
What can you tell me about this Blistering Plight?
I see.

node.text: Yeah, don't you know? It's in the Kingdom of Melloria, it is like the most prestigious place of learning ever; for real skills and knowledge mind you, not like one of those schools where you learn magic tricks.

But my master doesn't spend much time there, he prefers to be out in the field, like here. He always said there's only so much one can learn stuck inside stone walls while breathing moldy air. Yeah, I guess that's one reason why his collegues dislike him...

option.optiontext: What can you tell me about this Blistering Plight?
I see.

node.text: Though he won't admit it, I think my master could really use an extra pair of hands right now.

option.optiontext: What can you tell me about this Blistering Plight?
Your master, who is he exactly?

node.text: A plague doctor's outfit, eh? Now there's a challenge. It's not something I really make, but if you insist, I have a few ideas I could draw up for you. The execution will be entirely on you, however.

option.optiontext: I'm eager to learn. <color=yellow> Requires tailoring: 20 </color>
Sounds daunting, I'll have to think about it.

node.text: <color=#9C8C77>*Francis quickly draws patterns for you to study. You think you should be able to follow the instructions. The patterns describe the mask to be lined with a medicinal grass.*</color>

option.optiontext: The medicinal grass - where would I find such a thing?
Now all I need is the materials and a workbench.

node.text: Sweetgrass, you mean? Let me think... I suppose people have found it growing at the base of the city wall, outside the gates. Near undisturbed land, you know?

option.optiontext: Thanks for the advice.
Thanks for the advice.

node.text: <color=#9C8C77>*The man in the plague doctor outfit greets you in a thick, foreign accent.*</color>\n\nWho arrives? I am in ze middle of extracting a dead gentleman's spleen, disruptions are not welcome! At least you have ze appropriate protective attire, this is good.
I am apothecary, Sven. And who is ze gentleman I have ze pleasure to be conversing with? He is also interested in studies of ze plague, yes?

option.optiontext: It's a pleasure, I'm Lord Aercrest.
You may call me Rothar.
Your apprentice sent me - the one outside?

node.text: Ach, Mister Lorde, it is pleasure indeed. So, shall we discuss ze work at hand?

option.optiontext: No, Lord as in...

node.text: Ach okaaay, well I forget name soon so it does not really matter anyway. So, shall we discuss ze work at hand?

Who? Ach, he means ze girl. She is, how does one say... not imbecile? This is good, however, I have not ze desire to subject her to terrible sickness, and she does not have ze correct apparel such as you wear.

option.optiontext: You're studying the plague?

node.text: Blistering Plight, gentleman has heard of this? Fever, blisters, choking on yellow pus... ze full service, yes? No new cases for days, people think plague is gone, thus they rejoice. But no! I discover this plague is, ehm... insidious, perhaps?

option.optiontext: How so?

node.text: Sometimes plague kills, yes? But when body dies, plague stays still, dormant for a while. It grows, mutates, then... eruption, spores! New infection! People burn bodies, this is good practice. But some still remain, spores already developed, suit will be necessary!

option.optiontext: Where did this plague come from?
I take it you're not from around here?
You want me to burn corpses?

node.text: Gentleman is exactly correct. Southeast of here near ze city wall, it is where plagued bodies are piled on funeral pyres - ze plague corner one might call it. Have advised citizens to stay away, yet one must do ze dirty work still, with a torch in hand.

However! An opportunity for study is also presented. Perhaps gentleman takes my tissue sample jar. He may gather some plague pus from ze bodies, before burning them? He may then bring ze sample back to me for examine.

Hmm, there ze gentleman asks a very valid question. I have studied plagues for three decades. Pests usually spread them, then merchants also, once infected. Yes, however in this case... how does one say, ze city is ground zero?

No prior outbreaks reported elsewhere. I came here at once, believe I located patient zero, house is boarded up. But I asked around, nobody knew ze man. He was foreigner, but not a merchant. Arrives in ze city, rents a house, talks to no one - soon, ze plague spreads.

option.optiontext: Wait, you don't think this was deliberate?
You're not from around here, are you?
So, you want me to burn corpses?

node.text: It is mystery, but I have no evidence to draw conclusions from, yes? Ze plagued house, it presents a problem. Plague may spread still, I think - another wave? But let's deal with one step at a time, as one might say.

option.optiontext: You're not from around here, are you?
So, you want me to burn corpses?

node.text: I arrive here from Bronswind Academy of Melloria. But perhaps gentleman recognizes, Melloria is not where I grew up. That would be ze lands of Glimmerfiel; beautiful lands, everyone knows this. Also, not ze place for an academic mind, one might say.

option.optiontext: Where do you think the plague came from?
So, you want me to burn corpses?

node.text: Ze gentleman understands what's at stake? Ze plague may not yet be fully over, I must conduct further study.

option.optiontext: I'm in need of another tissue sample jar.
What did you need from me again?
Mind if I ask a few questions?

node.text: Ze gentleman may, although I must remind him that my test subject still awaits my attention. Spleen, kidney, stomach, heart and ze lungs of course... all must be carefully examined.

option.optiontext: I was curious to hear where you're from, Sven?
How did this plague get started in the first place?

node.text: I arrive here from Bronswind Academy of Melloria. But perhaps gentleman recognizes, Melloria is not where I grew up. That would be ze lands of Glimmerfiel; beautiful lands, everyone knows this. Also, not ze place for an academic mind, one might say.

option.optiontext: How do you think this plague got started?
I see.

node.text: Hmm, there ze gentleman asks a very valid question. I have studied plagues for three decades. Pests usually spread them, then merchants also, once infected. Yes, however in this case... how does one say, ze city is ground zero?

No prior outbreaks reported elsewhere. I came here at once, believe I located patient zero, house is boarded up. But I asked around, nobody knew ze man. He was foreigner, but not a merchant. Arrives in ze city, rents a house, talks to no one - soon, ze plague spreads.

option.optiontext: Wait, you don't think this was deliberate?
I was curious to hear where you're from, Sven?
I see.

node.text: It is mystery, but I have no evidence to draw conclusions from, yes? Ze plagued house, it presents a problem. Plague may spread still, I think - another wave? But let's deal with one step at a time, as one might say.

option.optiontext: I was curious to hear where you're from, Sven?
I see.

node.text: Southeast of here, near ze city walls, plague bodies still remain piled on funeral pyres. I have discovered ze plague continues to fester in dead bodies, creates infectious spores. Ze gentleman has protective gear, takes a torch to ze bodies, yes?

However, before destruction, if ze gentleman would be as kind as to collect a sample of plague pus from ze corpses. Once he has put ze bodies under ze torch so to say, he brings the sample back to me? It may be necessary to progress my studies.

option.optiontext: I'm in need of another tissue sample jar.
Mind if I ask a few questions?
I see.

node.text: Ach, ze gentleman returns, and he has ze sample of plague pus I requested? It is most excellent. Perhaps ze gentleman noticed ze house while burning bodies?
Ze one boarded up, X painted on windows and such, yes? First house to become infected, origin point for ze plague. Like ze corpses on ze street, highly problematic still - must be cleansed.

option.optiontext: Ah, so you want me to torch the house as well?
What do you propose we do?

node.text: I hope ze gentleman jests? Plague is no laughing matter, and where I come from, it is considered poor form to make jokes. In any case, burn ze house and you risk burning half ze city, yes? I have more elegant solution in mind.

While I study ze plague pus, perhaps gentleman could acquire another sample? I wish to examine an air sample from ze plagued house. However, since it is boarded up, he may have to be creative to gain entry.

option.optiontext: Where was this plagued house again?
How do I get an air sample?

node.text: So called plague corner, where he burned ze bodies, yes? House is boarded up, is difficult to mistake.

option.optiontext: How do I get an air sample?

node.text: He puts ze sample in ze jar, like last time, yes? He waves jar in ze air, thus air and plague spores go in ze jar. It is quite simple, yes?

option.optiontext: If you say so.

node.text: Yes, well burning corpses is one thing, but burning houses? Fire spreads, engulfs ze city - it is not appropriate. I must prepare a cleansing agent to save ze city, but I'm not yet sure what is effective.

Ze plague pus sample you brought me has advanced my understanding significantly, but I shall need ze air sample from ze infected house to confirm my beliefs. I am sure - with aid from ze gentleman - I will be able to cleanse ze house.

option.optiontext: I seem to have lost ze sample jar.
How should I go about acquiring ze air sample?
Mind if I ask a few questions?

node.text: Gentleman noticed ze house in plague corner, while burning bodies, yes? Boarded up, marked with X. In fact first house to become infected. Like ze corpses on ze street, highly problematic still - must be cleansed.
I must prepare ze appropriate cleansing agent, but cannot yet sure what is effective. Plague pus sample gentleman brought is helpful, but an air sample from ze infected house is also needed.

option.optiontext: But how do I get the correct sample though?
Mind if I ask a few questions?
If you say so.

node.text: He puts ze sample in ze jar, like last time, yes? He waves jar in ze air, thus air and plague spores go in ze jar. It is quite simple, yes?

option.optiontext: I seem to have lost ze sample jar.
Mind if I ask a few questions?
If you say so.

node.text: <color=#9C8C77>*As you arrive, the plague doctor looks up at you from midst his vials.*</color>\n\nI take it gentleman has acquired sample of infectious air?

option.optiontext: He has indeed.

node.text: <color=#9C8C77>*You hand over the jar and Sven immediately begins to analyze it through strangely curved lenses, all the while muttering to himself. After some time has passed, he finally speaks up.*</color>

Hmm, yes... I have seen something like this before, in Melloria. Similar, but different. Ze solution then was to burn an old medicinal plant as incense, I believe similar treatment will be effective here.

option.optiontext: An old medicinal plant?
Where should I look for it?

node.text: A folk remedy, one might say? Flower of ze Soothing Mallow. Traditionally people grew them everywhere - in gardens and homes - yet such wisdom is since forgotten. Ze plant offers potent medicine, make no mistake. Ancestors were not incorrect, one might say.

option.optiontext: Where should I look for it?

node.text: These days it is a rare find. There was a druidic gentleman in ze city, I briefly spoke with him before. Talk of ze flower came up, he said he has found it on ze cliffs by ze river, southeast of ze city, between here and ze Fenwater Village.
If ze gentleman would be so kind, bring back a bushel of five?

option.optiontext: Okay, ze gentleman is on it.

node.text: Once ze gentleman brings me Soothing Mallow, I may prepare it into an incense. I expect ze fumes will purify ze infected house. Only time will tell.

option.optiontext: Where should I look for this Soothing Mallow?
Mind if I ask a few questions?

node.text: These days it is a rare find. There was a druidic gentleman in ze city, I briefly spoke with him before. Talk of ze flower came up, he said he has found it on ze cliffs by ze river, southeast of ze city, between here and ze Fenwater Village. I hope this knowledge is of help.

option.optiontext: Mind if I ask a few questions?
We shall see.

node.text: Ze plague house must be purified. If gentleman does not succeed, ze city could be facing a second wave. Much is at stake, yes?

option.optiontext: I've lit the incense in the house.
Do you have any more of that incense?
Still, I was hoping to ask a few questions.

node.text: Ze fate of ze city lies at stake, yet gentleman wishes to talk. Very well, he may ask.

option.optiontext: I was curious to hear where you're from, Sven?
How did this plague get started in the first place?

node.text: Yes, but has he resealed ze entrance? Incense will take time to do its work. Townsfolk may still be in danger, if one chooses to enter, yes?

option.optiontext: Can you be sure they haven't already?
I was hoping to ask a few questions.

node.text: I cannot, yet we must do ze best we can. Then, we can only wait and see, and hope for ze best.

option.optiontext: I was hoping to ask a few questions.

node.text: Ach, ze gentleman returns! I have come to expect good news whenever he does. I assume he has ze herbs? They will provide us with a purifying incense.

option.optiontext: There was an odd... encounter.
Indeed, I have the Soothing Mallow.

node.text: Odd encounter, how does he mean? I am unable to draw conclusions from such a vague statement.

option.optiontext: I was attacked by some rabid adventurer - Kyler Plair?
Nevermind, I got you your herbs.

node.text: Ach, I see... Yes, such things are known to happen unfortunately. Some men just want to watch ze world burn, yes? But you have ze herbs? It is most important, I suggest gentleman puts ze rest behind him.

option.optiontext: Anyway, I have your Soothing Mallow.

node.text: Then I have but one task remaining for ze gentleman, yet it is ze one with utmost gravity. Ze plague corner house, ground zero for Blistering Plight - it must be properly cleansed.
<color=#9C8C77>*Sven rubs the Soothing Mallow with a greyish powder, which seems to instantly drain all moisture out of the plants.*</color>
Ze plague house remains a critical threat, especially after gentleman entered to acquire ze air sample. Fools often do not stay away. Gentleman may now take ze incense.

I ask that gentleman properly lights ze incense once he returns to ze plague house. Then, gentleman should board up ze house again. If ze incense is to work, it will take time. Townsfolk must be kept away, yes?

option.optiontext: It has been a pleasure to work with you, Sven.
I shall go at once!

node.text: Ze honor is mine, gentleman. He makes an apprentice most excellent and capable. Now he must make haste!

option.optiontext: I'm on my way.

node.text: Incense is burning, house is boarded, yes? I wonder, is ze gentleman aware of how great his service to this city? Sadly I hear its ruler is tyrant, no rewards to be expected from him. But many lives were possibly saved.

option.optiontext: Do you think the incense is going to cut it?
Then our work here is done.

node.text: Confident, but cannot be certain. There was not enough time for study and experimentation, had to work fast to cleanse ze house, yes? But without our actions, situation would have no hope.

option.optiontext: Then our work here is done.

node.text: For now, I must thank ze gentleman for being an excellent substitute apprentice. If he wishes to conduct his own experiments, he may check my supply of corpses in ze backyard. Also, I have an alchemical solution for ze gentleman he may find most useful.

option.optiontext: Um, I can just... borrow your corpses?
Alchemical solution?
Thank you Sven, it's most appreciated.

node.text: Oh yes, there has been steady supply of them. I trust gentleman would not have gotten this far if he was shy of corpses, yes?

option.optiontext: And the alchemical solution?
Thank you Sven, it's most appreciated.

node.text: Yes, I expect gentleman may find use for it when out in ze dangerous world, being ambushed by nefarious characters when picking herbs and such.

option.optiontext: Um, and I can just... borrow your corpses?
Thank you Sven, it's most appreciated.

node.text: Gentleman is always welcome, I look forward to working with him again, should a case arise. It has been a pleasure.
<color=#9C8C77>*Sven looks up at you from his studies, his features ever hidden by his plague mask. You wonder, does he ever take it off?*</color>
Ach, it is ze gentleman! What can be done for him?

option.optiontext: Can't help but wonder, do you ever take that mask off?
Wanted to ask about the plague...
There's something random I wanted to ask you.
I'll see you later, Sven.

node.text: Hah, gentleman is not ze first to wonder, nor will he be ze last I imagine. Of course mask must come off sometimes, somehow I have to eat, yes? In fairness, I suppose not many people have seen my face, or remember it.

option.optiontext: Wanted to ask about the plague...
There's something random I wanted to ask you.
That's all I really wanted to know.

node.text: Ach yes, ze plague...

option.optiontext: Think we really stopped it?
How do you think it got started in the first place?
What are the symptoms?
Actually, had another question...

node.text: Of course, I have time for ze gentleman.

option.optiontext: I was curious to hear where you're from, Sven?
How do you feel about your apprentice outside?
Actually, wanted to ask about the plague...

node.text: Confident, but cannot be certain. There was not enough time for study and experimentation, had to work fast to cleanse ze house, yes? But without our actions, situation would have no hope.

option.optiontext: How do you think it got started in the first place?
What are the symptoms?
Actually, had another question...

node.text: Hmm, there ze gentleman asks a very valid question. I have studied plagues for three decades. Pests usually spread them, then merchants also, once infected. Yes, however in this case... how does one say, ze city is ground zero?

No prior outbreaks reported elsewhere. I came here at once, believe I located patient zero, house is boarded up. But I asked around, nobody knew ze man. He was foreigner, but not a merchant. Arrives in ze city, rents a house, talks to no one - soon, ze plague spreads.

option.optiontext: You don't think it was spread deliberately?
Think we really stopped it?
What are the symptoms?
Actually, had another question...
I see.

node.text: It is mystery, but I have no evidence to draw conclusions from. Perhaps such evidence will yet surface? I do not enjoy unsolved mysteries.

option.optiontext: Think we really stopped it?
What are the symptoms?
Actually, had another question...

node.text: Approximately 3 or 4 days upon coming into contact with ze infection, patient develops heavy shivers and sweating, they begin coughing, fever breaks soon after...

Fever rises, cough worsens, skin reddens... Yellow pus begins to come out of lungs. Skin, it breaks into red blisters. Perhaps one in five infected loses life, for elderly and weak perhaps every three in four.

option.optiontext: How do you think it got started in the first place?
Think we really stopped it?
Actually, had another question...
Indeed, grim.

node.text: I arrive here from Bronswind Academy of Melloria. But perhaps gentleman recognizes, Melloria is not where I grew up. That would be ze lands of Glimmerfiel; beautiful lands, everyone knows this. Also, not ze place for an academic mind, one might say.

option.optiontext: How so?
How do you feel about your apprentice outside?
Wanted to ask about the plague...
I see.

node.text: Glimmerfiel, people are very... agrarian? Very traditional and religious, yes? One might say my mind was not best liked, I was considered misfit. I often miss ze land, but also I have not been back in over three decades.

option.optiontext: How do you feel about your apprentice outside?
Wanted to ask about the plague...
I understand..

node.text: Ze girl has a sharp enough mind, but alas, she was too inexperienced in ze face of this plague. This is understandable, I do not blame her. She has far to go yet and I wish to see she gets there, yes?

option.optiontext: I was curious to hear where you're from, Sven?
Wanted to ask about the plague...
Yes, indeed.

node.text: <color=#9C8C77>*The merchant eyes you as you approach, while quietly enjoying his drink in the corner.*</color>\n\nYou don't look like any other peasant who walks into this tavern. Makes a man wonder, you good at solving problems?

option.optiontext: Depends on what you want.
Just here for a drink...

node.text: Heard about the lawlessness down south, in Haywind? Forest roads crawling with marauders, an entire village razed... Merchant caravans don't like their chances traveling to the city. Just as well, most who try end up robbed.

option.optiontext: They razed a village?
Traders are avoiding Haywind right now?
What's your interest in it?

node.text: They sure did, pity the folk of Baronsgreene. Those who did get away, well... they lost their homes and everything. Marked the beginning of Haywind's troubles.

option.optiontext: Traders are avoiding Haywind right now?
So what's your interest in it?

node.text: Can you blame them? Some risk it sure, but most traders have dissipated. Not only can you lose your goods on the road, can just as easily lose your life too.

option.optiontext: The bandits razed a village?
So what's your interest in it?

node.text: The city's starving for goods, and that provides an opportunity. Anyone capable of procuring said goods can reap great profits. I'm a man who likes the sound of great profits, but I'm not so silly as to risk the road - the river offers a much safer route.

Thus I've invested a small sum into a boat. There's just one slight problem. Er... see, I'm an aspiring investor, but not a man of great funds just yet, so I had to choose the boat accordingly. How about we meet out in the harbor? It'll be easier to show than explain.

option.optiontext: Fair enough.

node.text: Ah, you made it. May I present to you my great pride and joy, the river barge James Baynes, named after myself of course.

option.optiontext: I don't understand, where's the boat?

node.text: Ahem, you're looking at it right now. As I said, it's the best I could do, but it'll serve perfectly I'm sure. After slight repairs of course.

option.optiontext: Slight repairs? It won't get out of the harbor without sinking!

node.text: Ah, well yes. Which is why I'm hiring you as the man to oversee the logistics of this operation. You see, I tend to be more of the 'big picture' guy. You already seem to understand boats better than I do.

option.optiontext: <color=#9C8C77>*Examine the barge.*</color>
<color=#9C8C77>*Examine the barge.*</color>
I'll see what I can do...

node.text: Indeed, simple tools may be bought across many general stores in the city. Not to worry, I'll be sure to compensate any and all expenses once the job is complete.

option.optiontext: How generous...

node.text: Perfect! Knew I had you pegged as the right man for the job. I'll be right here in case you happen to need any, erm... strategic advice?
<color=#9C8C77>*It's in a fairly bad shape, but if I had two planks, a hammer and some rope, I suppose I could get the boat serviceable again.*</color>

option.optiontext: Guess I'll need some planks and tools...
Think I know what to do.

node.text: <color=red>*Requires at least level 15 in Crafting.*</color>\n\n<color=#9C8C77>*The boat looks like a mess. I'd probably need a bit more practice in Crafting to be able to fix her up.*</color>

option.optiontext: I'll have to see what I can do...

node.text: Sure it's seen better days, but I think with a bit of care and slight repairs the boat will be running up and down the river like a beauty!

option.optiontext: <color=#9C8C77>*Examine the barge.*</color>
<color=#9C8C77>*Examine the barge.*</color>
To me it looks ready to sink the moment it's pushed off the jetty...
If you say so.

node.text: Know what I see when I look at you? I see a practical man of many talents. That's right, I'm someone who sees talents in other people. And you my friend... well I'm sure you have it in you to make the boat look like new again!

option.optiontext: <color=#9C8C77>*Examine the barge.*</color>
<color=#9C8C77>*Examine the barge.*</color>
If you say so.

node.text: <color=#9C8C77>*It's in a fairly bad shape, but if I had two planks, a hammer and some rope, I suppose I could get the boat serviceable again.*</color>

option.optiontext: Guess I'll need some planks and tools...

node.text: <color=red>*Requires at least level 15 in Crafting.*</color>\n\n<color=#9C8C77>*The boat looks like a mess. I'd probably need a bit more practice in Crafting to be able to fix her up.*</color>

option.optiontext: Honestly it looks ready to sink the moment it's pushed off the jetty...
Oh dear...

node.text: Indeed, simple tools may be bought across many general stores in the city. Not to worry, I'll be sure to compensate any and all expenses once the job is complete.

option.optiontext: Honestly it looks ready to sink the moment it's pushed off the jetty...
How generous...

node.text: Hah, just look at her! Isn't she a beauty? I never doubted you for a moment!

option.optiontext: So what now?

node.text: Now we load her up and set our sights on Haywind. I want you to oversee the trip, but we should first hire someone who knows the waterways. Someone who can steer clear of the bandits preying on the river banks.

Perhaps you could head back to the tavern and persuade one of the men there to take on the challenge? I won't lie, the're usually not the most trustworthy of sorts, but they're skilled on water. Besides, I have you to make sure they toe the line, don't I?

option.optiontext: I suppose...

node.text: Just look at it! My very own boat, perfectly sea... erm, river-worthy!

option.optiontext: When do we take off?

node.text: I want you to oversee the trip, but we should first hire someone who knows the waterways. Someone who can steer clear of the bandits preying on the river banks. Perhaps you could head back to the tavern and persuade one of the men there to take on the challenge?
I won't lie, the're usually not the most trustworthy of sorts, but they're skilled on water. Besides, I have you to make sure they toe the line, don't I?

option.optiontext: I suppose...

node.text: What're you lookin' at, eh?!

option.optiontext: Need an experienced sailor for a daring trip down the river.
I'm looking for a secret passage into Thornhill Dungeons.
Will you stop screaming at everyone?

node.text: Oh yeah?! Well I need beer, lots of it. I want five mugs, but the lady here won't sell it to me. Says she don't like me when I drink, says I turn mean. I say you get me beer, and maybe we can talk business.

option.optiontext: I have a job for you and you're seriously bartering about beer?

node.text: Well you can go look elsewhere! I'm not in the mood for your questions!
How about you mind your own business?! I do what I want! People really oughta respect me more! I'm not someone to trifle with!

option.optiontext: Whatever, I need an experienced sailor for a daring trip down the river.

node.text: I want what I want! I never do jobs sober anyway, is bad luck! 5 mugs of beer, no less. Otherwise you can forget about this job of yours.
You want to hire me? Fine, but first I want 5 mugs of beer. The lady here won't sell it to me. Says she don't like me when I drink...

option.optiontext: Fine, you can have your beer...
How can I even expect you to be fit for this job?
Will you stop screaming at everyone?

node.text: You don't tell me what to do! Not you, not anyone! I do what I want, and I want what I want. And what I want is beer.

option.optiontext: How can I even expect you to be fit for this job?
Fine, have your beer...

node.text: See any other sailors in here right now? I know what I can do, and what I do is handle boats. I know my stuff, and I know it even better boozed up. I ain't doing any jobs unless I get my beer!

option.optiontext: But will you just stop screaming at everyone?
Fine, have your beer...

node.text: Alright, this should get me going. So why don't you tell me about this job...
With an experienced sailor in hand, the James Baynes is finally ready to begin its voyage! Are you ready, my friend?

option.optiontext: I'm ready to embark.
Should I be expecting trouble on the river?
I don't trust our sailor...
Not quite.

node.text: Good, because I wouldn't either - not as far as I could throw him. Sadly, we don't have much choice in the quality of manpower in Thornhill harbor these days. But that's why I'll be relying on you to oversee the trip.

option.optiontext: Should I be expecting trouble on the river?
I'm ready to embark.
There are still preparations I wish to make.

node.text: I have heard of boats getting attacked, so yeah. But that's why we need a good sailor. It'll be his job to find a route through that steers clear of the worst sites of ambush.

option.optiontext: Our sailor, I don't trust that man...
I'm ready to embark.
There are still preparations I wish to make.

node.text: Well good, hop on the boat! I'll sneak across on land and greet you on the other side, at Haywind harbor. Best of luck, my friend - I'm counting on you!
Hop on the boat whenever you're ready. I'll sneak across on land and greet you on the other side, at Haywind harbor. Best of luck, my friend - I'm counting on you!

option.optiontext: Should I be expecting trouble on the river?
I don't trust our sailor...

node.text: I have heard of boats getting attacked, so yeah. But that's why we need a good sailor. It'll be his job to find a route through that steers clear of the worst sites of ambush.

option.optiontext: I don't trust our sailor...

node.text: Good, because I wouldn't either - not as far as I could throw him. Sadly, we don't have much choice in the quality of manpower in Thornhill harbor these days. But that's why I'll be relying on you to oversee the trip.

option.optiontext: Should I be expecting trouble on the river?

node.text: Glad to see you made it in one piece, along with my cargo! I don't see our sailor though...

option.optiontext: Must've fallen overboard...

node.text: <color=#9C8C77>*Chuckles.*</color>\nI see... Turned out to be an unreliable man, then. But that's fine by me, means you earn his share. Besides, seems to me I can hire more trustworthy sailors in this city anyway.

Tell you what, I'll throw in a little bonus for a job well done; feel free to hop on my trade boat any time you're looking to hitch a ride between these two cities. I reckon it ought to be safer than taking the road anyway.

option.optiontext: Thanks, good luck!

node.text: Yo ho boi! , where ya think ya going without gifting me some pennies?

option.optiontext: Show me what you got bitchu

node.text: Hmm... Regretfully, some of my instructors are of the mind that you are not yet fully formed in all aspects expected in a member of our Academy.\n\n<color=#9C8C77>*You need a minimum of level 25 across all skills to truly impress the Thornhill Masters.*</color>

option.optiontext: Feels bad...

node.text: I sense, however, that within you reside the qualities of persistence and perseverance! Those are highly valued qualities by us here at the Academy of Masters. Continue to work on yourself and you may yet pass our strict standards for excellence!
My instructors say you show promise, very good, very good... very well...

option.optiontext: I knew I was worthy to be recognized as a member!

node.text: Hm? No, no, let's not get ahead of ourselves... However, what you have done is earn yourself the right to prove yourself worthy. Each member of our Academy has demonstrated commitment by carrying out an extraordinary service to our institution.

There is one pressing matter, in fact, with which you might prove most helpful. Our Academy has traditionally received its funding from the city, which under recent rulership has only been cut ever smaller. Now the Lord Mayor has decreed we shall not see a single copper coin unless we show our value to him.

He's heard of cannons built in distant lands and demands we make one for him. Most brutish and uncivilized, if you ask me, but there it is. I sent a fellow, a genius of engineering, Norman Osborrow to manage the project. But he's an old man, he will require someone to do the heavy lifting for him, which is where you can help.

option.optiontext: Cannons... aren't they some sort of myth and legend?
So where should I meet Norman?

node.text: Oh no, I assure you such inventions are quite real, and have been produced to varying degrees of quality in foreign realms. All it takes is a bit of skill, knowledge and ingenuity. Norman has seen the contraptions with his own eyes and knows them in principle, but he'll need your help with the execution.

option.optiontext: So where should I meet Norman?

node.text: The Lord Mayor established a secret site overlooking the bay for the cannon's development, Norman's already there waiting for you. You'll need to ask one of the guards at the Lord Mayor's castle to escort you there - good luck!

option.optiontext: Very well.

node.text: Ah, you must be a newcomer here? Allow me to welcome you to Thornhill's Academy of Masters! Let's get the formalities out of the way, I am Headmaster Trevelyan and I presume you come seeking knowledge?

option.optiontext: I wish to join your society.
The Academy of Masters?
Makes sense.

node.text: So you say, so you say... but here, in these prestigious halls, full membership demands proof of excellence! I must first hear a recommendation from each of the Academy Masters to establish a baseline. Do you submit yourself to their examination?

option.optiontext: Sure, why not.
Tell me more about the Academy first.
I don't need to prove anything to anyone.

node.text: Very good! This will only take a moment, as I summon Thornhill's Masters to assess you in the Academy gardens...

You must ask? But surely you would not be here, had our reputation not preceded us! This is only the most esteemed, the most prestigious, the most venerated and revered center of learning in all the northern woodlands of Imberthale!

I must warn you, we do not let just anyone study here - there are certain standards that must be upheld! I'm well aware the upstarts in the city of Haywind have set up their own ''college'', if one can call it such, in service of all manner of inept commoners. But here in Thornhill, at least, we're aware tradition in learning counts for something.

option.optiontext: And what standards do you uphold exactly?
I believe myself worthy to join your society.

node.text: You must demonstrate a sufficient level of knowledge in any one skill before our Masters will even consider providing you with advanced training. In addition, if you wish to be recognized as a full fledged member of our great Academy, you must prove your talents in a wide variety of fields.
<color=#9C8C77>*To unlock training from a Thornhill Master, you must possess at least 20 levels in their respective skill.*</color>

option.optiontext: I believe myself worthy to join your society.

node.text: How goes your work on the cannon research project? It is not my intent to pile pressure, but the future of our great Academy may depend on your success...

option.optiontext: Remind me, how do I get to the cannon build site?
So why do you need my help in building a cannon?
What can you tell me about your Academy?
I'm working on it.

node.text: Ah yes, the Lord Mayor is very protective about that. You'll have to meet up with one of his sergeants by Thornhill Castle gates, who'll escort you there. A chap named Almsworth, as I recall.

option.optiontext: So why do you need my help in building a cannon?
What can you tell me about your Academy?
I see.

node.text: Why, it's quite simple. The Lord Mayor has threatened not to lend a single copper coin in funding to the Academy anymore unless we find a way to demonstrate our usefulness to him. He's heard of cannons built in distant lands and demands we make one for him.

I sent a fellow, a genius of engineering, Norman Osborrow to manage the project. He'll have come up with blueprints for a cannon for certain, but... he's an old man, he will require someone skilled and reliable to do the heavy lifting for him.

option.optiontext: Remind me, how do I get to the cannon build site?
What can you tell me about your Academy?
I see.

node.text: You must ask? But surely you would not be here, had our reputation not preceded us! This is only the most esteemed, the most prestigious, the most venerated and revered center of learning in all the northern woodlands of Imberthale!

I must warn you, we do not let just anyone study here - there are certain standards that must be upheld! I'm well aware the upstarts in the city of Haywind have set up their own ''college'', if one can call it such, in service of all manner of inept commoners. But here in Thornhill, at least, we're aware tradition in learning counts for something.

option.optiontext: And what standards do you uphold exactly?
Remind me, how do I get to the cannon build site?
So why do you need my help in building a cannon?
I see.

node.text: You have already demonstrated a sufficient level of knowledge to qualify for advanced training from our Masters, but if you truly wish to be recognized as a full fledged member of our great Academy, you must provide us with an extraordinary service.

option.optiontext: Remind me, how do I get to the cannon build site?
So why do you need my help in building a cannon?
I see.

node.text: I received word your work on the cannon was a great success! The Lord Mayor was very pleased with the results and he's agreed to extend our funding for now. The Academy of Masters thanks you for your service!

option.optiontext: Have I finally earned recognition in your academy then?

node.text: Most certainly! I've let our staff around the city know you are to be treated as an honorary member of the Academy, which I'll have you know, entitles you to certain slight privileges.

As an additional token of appreciation for the great service you performed for us, I had the Master of Alchemy draft a recipe you might find most... explosive! I must warn you, it's not the easiest concoction to brew, and may require some additional experience to create yourself.

option.optiontext: You said an honorary member is entitled to privileges?
Very good!
option.actions: UpdateQuest=108-999,NpcChat=Know that our doors remain always open for you!

node.text: Quite so! The Thornhill Academy employs a number of busybodies around the city, who acquire and transport materials for Academy inventions. By your request, they will also cart an honorary member to various locations in the city, speeding your way.
You may recognize our Academy servants by the blue flags they've raised at their stations. In fact, there's a man stationed just outside the Academy entrance, should you wish to meet him.

option.optiontext: Very good!
option.actions: UpdateQuest=108-999,NpcChat=Know that our doors remain always open for you!

node.text: You are welcomed as a member of our most prestigious academy! As always, the great knowledge we offer is yours, should you wish to learn.

option.optiontext: So, the Lord Mayor threatened to cut off the Academy's funding?
You said an honorary member of the Academy is entitled to privileges?

node.text: Yes, but thanks to you that matter is now resolved... for now - he got his cannon and we get our upkeep. However, I dread to think of the next time he decides to blackmail us for some brutish innovation.

option.optiontext: You said an honorary member of the Academy is entitled to privileges?
Good luck...

node.text: Quite so! The Thornhill Academy employs a number of busybodies around the city, who acquire and transport materials for Academy inventions. By your request, they will also cart an honorary member to various locations in the city, speeding your way.
You may recognize our Academy servants by the blue flags they've raised at their stations. In fact, there's a man stationed just outside the Academy entrance, should you wish to meet him.

option.optiontext: So, the Lord Mayor threatened to cut off the Academy's funding?
I see.

node.text: <color=#9C8C77>*Here's the site where you're expected to put the cannon together.*</color>

option.optiontext: <color=#9C8C77>*Install the cannon frame.*</color>
<color=#9C8C77>*Install the barrel of the cannon.*</color>
<color=#9C8C77>*Install the cannonballs.*</color>
<color=#9C8C77>*Install the pouch of black powder.*</color>
I'm still missing the cannon frame...
I'm still missing the cannon barrel...
I'm still missing five cannonballs...
I'm still missing the black powder pouch...

node.text: <color=#9C8C77>*You set the wooden frame on the ground, eagerly awaiting to receive the barrel of the cannon...*</color>
<color=#9C8C77>*You bring out the mighty barrel ready to be installed...*</color>
<color=#9C8C77>*You neatly stack the cannonballs to an appropriate spot to await being loaded into the cannon once it's complete...*</color>
<color=#9C8C77>*You place the powder pouch in a safe spot to avoid having it explode by accident...*</color>
<color=#9C8C77>*I could always ask the Master Engineer to remind me about how to craft one.*</color>

Heh, the fuse on our good captain here is beginning to run short. I've been instructing the workers I've been provided as best I can, but they simply lack the finesse and attention to detail that is required in demanding works such as this. I do hope you're the good man the Academy sent to aid me?

Ah yes, I had received word from the Academy Headmaster that he'd be sending someone with talents to assist me. I may have a fine head for blueprints on the contruction of a cannon, but execution itself is still half the work, and must be performed with precision!

Alas, this is poorly understood by my impatient taskmaster here. The good captain threatened to apply my head as a hammer if I don't start delivering results soon. I believe you arrive in good time to prevent my highly unfortunate, yet pending demise.

option.optiontext: Let's get to the cannon itself - how can I help?

node.text: <color=#9C8C77>*Master Osborrow presents to you his designs for the cannon.*</color>\n\nAs you can see, I need you to deliver four major components to the build site for the cannon's completion. Namely, its wooden frame, the barrel of the cannon, a stack of cannonballs of course, and finally a pouch of black powder - the magic of the whole thing.

option.optiontext: How do I go about building the cannon frame?
How do I go about building the cannon's barrel?
How do I go about making the cannonballs?
How do I go about making a pouch of black powder exactly?
Alright, anything else I should know?

node.text: For that thing, you'll have to hammer a lot of good iron into shape. Take 8 iron ingots to an anvil, that should be roughly enough to shape them according to my specifications. Remember to drop the completed barrel off at the cannon's build site.

option.optiontext: How do I go about building the cannon frame?
How do I go about making the cannonballs?
How do I go about making a pouch of black powder exactly?
Alright, anything else I should know?

node.text: The key to a good frame to support the cannon is the choice of wood, and I have just the thing in mind. Have you ever visited Prowler's Thicket south of the city? If you get 8 logs of the Wildsfir trees that grow there, it should be enough for a sturdy frame. You'll be needing a bunch of nails <color=#9C8C77>(5)</color> to hold it together also. You can drop the completed frame off at the cannon's build site.

option.optiontext: How do I go about building the cannon's barrel?
How do I go about making the cannonballs?
How do I go about making a pouch of black powder exactly?
Alright, anything else I should know?

node.text: You'll need to shape iron at the forge into tightly packed ammunition. For each cannonball you'll require an iron ingot, and a log of oak to get the fires burning nice and hot. Once you've completed a sufficient stack of 5, you're ready to drop them off at the cannon's build site.

option.optiontext: How do I go about making a pouch of black powder exactly?
How do I go about building the cannon frame?
How do I go about building the cannon's barrel?
Alright, anything else I should know?

node.text: Ah yes, that will be the most demanding component. For the explosive material itself, you should mine Black Stone at the cliffs in southern Prowler's Thicket, I believe it's found directly south of Harshwind Village. Do try to bring back sufficient quantities of that stuff <color=#9C8C77>(a full stack of 5 is required)</color>.

You'll also need a strong pouch to hold the material safely, I advise to use 10 cotton at the tailor's workbench to sow into a container. Once you have the material, and the pouch, the final step remaining is to refine Black Stone sand into functional black powder at the alchemist's workbench. As ever, the full black powder pouch you ought to drop off at the cannon's build site.

option.optiontext: How do I go about building the cannon frame?
How do I go about building the cannon's barrel?
How do I go about making the cannonballs?
Alright, anything else I should know?

node.text: Remember to install all the cannon parts you complete at the construction site, so I'll be ready to inspect the cannon once it's complete. I've had the Lord Mayor's men set up all the crafting stations you should need here at this site - a request they thankfully fulfilled, seeing as they have proven of little use in anything else. Feel free to utilize them as much as you wish.

option.optiontext: I'll see what I can do...

node.text: I really do appreciate your help here. The good captain threatened to apply my head as a hammer if I don't start delivering results soon. I believe in delivering to him the cannon he desperately wants, you may also be saving my life.

option.optiontext: I've completed all the work on the cannon...
Let's go over the cannon's specs one more time.
Remind me, how should I go about creating the cannon's frame?
Remind me, how do I make the barrel?
Remind me, how will I make cannonballs?
Remind me, what's required for the black powder pouch?

node.text: Four major components will have to be installed at the build site dedicated for the cannon; the frame, the barrel, cannonballs and a pouch of blackpowder. You can use the crafting stations here to create the required components.

option.optiontext: Well, I've completed all the work on the cannon...
Remind me, how should I go about creating the cannon's frame?
Remind me, how do I make the barrel?
Remind me, how will I make cannonballs?
Remind me, what's required for the black powder pouch?

node.text: The key to a good frame to support the cannon is the choice of wood, and I have just the thing in mind. Have you ever visited Prowler's Thicket south of the city? If you get 8 logs of the Wildsfir trees that grow there, it should be enough for a sturdy frame. You'll be needing a bunch of nails <color=#9C8C77>(5)</color> to hold it together also. You can drop the completed frame off at the cannon's build site.

option.optiontext: What about the barrel then?
What about cannonballs then?
What about the black powder pouch?
Alright, thanks.

node.text: For that thing, you'll have to hammer a lot of good iron into shape. Take 8 iron ingots to an anvil, that should be roughly enough to shape them according to my specifications. Remember to drop the completed barrel off at the cannon's build site.

option.optiontext: What about cannonballs then?
What about the black powder pouch?
What about the frame then?
Alright, thanks.

node.text: You'll need to shape iron at the forge into tightly packed ammunition. For each cannonball you'll require an iron ingot, and a log of oak to get the fires burning nice and hot. Once you've completed a sufficient stack of 5, you're ready to drop them off at the cannon's build site.

option.optiontext: What about the black powder pouch?
What about the frame then?
What about the barrel then?
Alright, thanks.

node.text: Ah yes, that will be the most demanding component. For the explosive material itself, you should mine Black Stone at the cliffs in southern Prowler's Thicket, I believe it's found directly south of Harshwind Village. Do try to bring back sufficient quantities of that stuff <color=#9C8C77>(a full stack of 5 is required)</color>.

You'll also need a strong pouch to hold the material safely, I advise to use 10 cotton at the tailor's workbench to sow into a container. Once you have the material, and the pouch, the final step remaining is to refine Black Stone sand into functional black powder at the alchemist's workbench. As ever, the full black powder pouch you ought to drop off at the cannon's build site.

option.optiontext: What about the frame then?
What about the barrel then?
What about cannonballs then?
Alright, thanks.

node.text: Ah, how fine! I was beginning to fear the captain would lose whatever's left of his short patience before you had the chance to finish the work. Now let's see, I believe a demonstration is in order...

Ah, hahaha! Magnificent! The sound, nay the roar of the thing, I had almost forgotten...! Last time I heard cannonfire was decades ago, traveling and studying in the lands of Melloria - oh, to witness the Great Mortar of Eisendread once more... Today I was reminded what it was like to be a younger man again!

I do believe the Captain was quite satisfied with your work here, and you have my thanks for quite possibly saving my life. I'm sure the Headmaster back at the Academy of Masters would also like to extend his gratitude towards you.

option.optiontext: Then I shouldn't keep him waiting.
option.actions: UpdateQuest=108-4,NpcChat=I bid you good luck in your endeavors> friend!

node.text: Say the word when you need to leave. I'll have to personally escort you out, otherwise Lord Mayor will have my hide. Can't risk stragglers in his castle grounds.

option.optiontext: I wish to return to the city...

node.text: Fair enough, stick closeby then and I'll see you out.
The Castle is off limits! The Lord Mayor's secluded himself from common rabble like yourself, so you best move along, if you know what's good for you.

option.optiontext: I'm working on behalf of the Academy for the Lord Mayor's cannon project.
The Lord Mayor's locked himself in?

node.text: Ah right, they sent a messenger about you... Alright then, but I'm to escort you there. Stick close to me, no one's to walk near the Castle grounds unsupervised!

Tempers in the city running real high these days, peasants haven't been as appreciative of their rightful liege as is their duty. Times like these, it's in the Lord Mayor's best interest to keep himself protected within castle walls.

option.optiontext: I'd like you to escort me to the cannon site now.
I'm working on behalf of the Academy for the Lord Mayor's cannon project.
Interesting news...

node.text: I know you? Ah yeah that's right, you're one of them from the cannon site. Gotta escort you there though, if that's the way you're headed. Lord Mayor's got the castle on lockdown and can't have anyone frolicking around here unsupervised.

option.optiontext: Escort away...
The Lord Mayor's locked himself in?

node.text: Master Solfurius at your service, sir! Headmaster Trevelyan gave your description for the newest member of the Academy. As such, I will freely transport you around the city, should you require it.

option.optiontext: I wish to travel.
What can you tell me about this area?

node.text: My station's called Castle and Cemetery, sir. That's because it's nestled between the Castle to the west, and the Cemetery to the east, sir.

option.optiontext: I wish to travel.

node.text: Very well, sir. I can cart you to any of our other stations in no time; Scholar's by the Academy, Beggar's Households by the eastern side of the city, or Wharfside at the docks north. Where would you like to go?

option.optiontext: Take me to the Scholar's.
Take me to Beggar's Households.
Take me to Wharfside.

node.text: Very good, sir.
Very good, sir.
Very good, sir.
Master Arthurius at your service, sir! Headmaster Trevelyan gave your description for the newest member of the Academy. As such, I will freely transport you around the city, should you require it.

option.optiontext: I wish to travel.
What can you tell me about this area?

node.text: Sir...? This is the Academy, sir, as I'm sure you're aware. It is neatly positioned between the marketsquare towards north and the city gate towards south.

option.optiontext: I wish to travel.

node.text: Very well, sir. I can cart you to any of our other stations in no time; Cemetery and Castle to the northwest, Beggar's Households by the eastern side of the city, or Wharfside at the docks north. Where would you like to go?

option.optiontext: Take me to Cemetery and Castle.
Take me to Beggar's Households.
Take me to Wharfside.

node.text: Very good, sir.
Very good, sir.
Very good, sir.
Master Mercurius at your service, sir! Headmaster Trevelyan gave your description for the newest member of the Academy. As such, I will freely transport you around the city, should you require it.

option.optiontext: I wish to travel.
What can you tell me about this area?

node.text: These households may not look like much now, sir, but at the Academy we know this is a primary point of connection within the city - off to one side we have the Brinebridge leading across the river, while on the other side lies the infamous Beggar's Market, City Gates and the way to the docks.
Very well, sir. I can cart you to any of our other stations in no time; Cemetery and Castle to the west, Scholar's by the Academy, or Wharfside at the docks north. Where would you like to go?

option.optiontext: Take me to Cemetery and Castle.
Take me to the Scholar's.
Take me to Wharfside.

node.text: Very good, sir.
Very good, sir.
Very good, sir.
Mark my words, sir, in a few centuries property values in this area will be sky high, once the rest of the city catches on.

option.optiontext: I wish to travel.
Sage investment advice...

node.text: Master Victurius at your service, sir! Headmaster Trevelyan gave your description for the newest member of the Academy. As such, I will freely transport you around the city, should you require it.

option.optiontext: I wish to travel.
What can you tell me about this area?

node.text: This is the docks, sir - it's where boats are docked. Sometimes boats leave, then at times other boats arrive to take their place. Such is the depth of my understanding anyway.

option.optiontext: I wish to travel.

node.text: Very well, sir. I can cart you to any of our other stations in no time; Cemetery and Castle to the southwest, Scholar's by the Academy, or Beggar's Households by the eastern side of the city. Where would you like to go?

option.optiontext: Take me to Cemetery and Castle.
Take me to the Scholar's.
Take me to Beggar's Households.

node.text: Very good, sir.
Very good, sir.
Very good, sir.
